Monday evening the School Board passed a resolution having Benson Schools re-open in an In-Person learning model. In-Person Learning Model means all students will be back at school to start the 2020-2021 school year..

This decision was based upon collaboration and consultation with Countryside Public Health and MDE/MDH. Benson Schools will continue to monitor Covid-19 cases in Swift County through discussions with local and state health officials.

Please Note: Families have the option to select a Distance Learning model. Benson Schools will have a robust and engaging Distance Learning Plan for parents and students.

MN State High School League (MSHSL): The MSHSL Board of Directors met today (Tuesday) and announced plans for fall sports. There will be 4 sports seasons this school year. Tennis, b/g cross-country, b/g soccer, and swimming will start the fall season on August 17th and play with modified schedules. Football and Volleyball seasons have been moved to season 3 Winter/spring (Mid March-Mid May). Season 4 (spring) will be held Mid May-June.

Spaces in the junior high are being cleaned out to prepare for demolition in July. Much of the materials will be repurposed in the other new spaces. However, there are things that cannot be moved or used. We want to make sure the things that are not used are made available to the public.

The Junior High – middle floor and top floor will be open May 21 and May 22 from 8:00 am – 4:00 pm for the public to come in and take items that are in the hallway. The public can come in the south Junior High Door. For safety purposes, no one can go into the classrooms. If you would like a door/door frame, put your name on it and let Jason McVinua know and he will take it off for you at some point. Contact Jason to request another time, if needed. Once again, this is only for the middle floor and top floor. No one is allowed inside the classrooms or on the lower level.

Social distancing will be required to be followed. Only a limited number of people will be allowed in at a time.

Re: Summer Marching Band Canceled
_________________________________________________

Given the current Covid-19 pandemic and the health risks to Benson School students and staff, the decision has been made to cancel the 2020 Benson School’s Summer Marching Band season. Along with the Pioneer Band Parade and Memorial Day Parade, all other parades on the Benson Marching band schedule have been canceled. The Marching Band trip scheduled for Colorado this summer is also canceled.
Benson School’s Summer Marching Band has a long tradition of excellence and is a wonderful opportunity to showcase Benson Schools, our talented musicians, and our state leading music program. At the same time, marching band is a terrific time to for students to continue to build musical skills and have quality social time with classmates. This is a difficult decision as it is another opportunity that this virus has taken from students. We look forward to another exciting and successful Summer Marching Band season in 2021.

post_text:
The School Board considered a variety of options before concluding that a new building was the most cost-effective and prudent choice. Initial discussions revolved around the School District purchasing the Benson Civic Center. However, education facility building codes (specifically wind and snow load standards) were discovered as a costly obstacle. The School Board also explored leasing the Civic Center from the City, but the initial and long-term lease costs, in addition to the 40-year age of the building and lack of ownership in the asset was determined to be a costly barrier.

At the time of the 2018 referendum, the School District was in discussions and hopeful to utilize the Benson Civic Center for activity space and therefore a new building was not considered as a need at the time. Since then, the School Board has determined that the Civic Center does not provide the most economical, effective, or valuable option for ISD 777 and our community.

Learn more about the 2020 Bond Referendum at: https://bit.ly/2xCIufC

The students simply would have to kiss their fingers and place their fingers on their forehead. A memorial similar to this one is also hanging in the Benson Public Library, where Cory was a member of "Friends of the Library".
